thread.title: Kyle Lowry to miss 2nd game with wrist injury
thread.title_full: Kyle Lowry to miss 2nd game with wrist injury

author: cbc
title: Kyle Lowry to miss 2nd game with wrist injury
text:
Toronto Raptors point guard Kyle Lowry will sit out tonight's game against the visiting Portlad Trail Blazers with a wrist injury.
Tests on Lowry's sore right wrist showed no significant damage, the team announced before Sunday's game.
"It's going to be day to day, treated symptomatically," coach Dwane Casey said. "Swelling's gone down, so that's a good sign. We'll see. He'll be day to day.
"It wasn't broken," Casey added.
"He's (Lowry) not going to go tonight... He's day-to-day." - Casey on Kyle's status. pic.twitter.com/H9vLoL3RIf
— @Raptors Lowry hurt his wrist in the Feb. 15 game versus Charlotte, but played in the NBA all-star game four days later in New Orleans explaining that he didn't believe the injury was serious.
He sat out Friday's 107-97 win over Boston, wearing a brace on the wrist.
© The Canadian Press, 2017
